images.caption: Figure 1:(Left):The proposed ActiveKD framework consistently improves the final-round accuracy of baseline selection methods, whilePCoreSetoutperforms other baselines when combined with ActiveKD.(Right):ActiveKD consistently improves the performance ofPCoreSetacross active learning rounds (No Distill vs. Zero-shot Distill), with further gains when using few-shot teachers (Few-shot Distill).
Figure 2:An overview of ActiveKD.

Table 1:Results on ImageNet and average across 10 datasets with different AL frameworks at the final AL round. We report average and 95% CI over 5 runs.
Figure 5:Results on ImageNet(Top)and average across 10 datasets(Bottom)over AL rounds. Zero- and Few-shot share the y-axis for comparison.
Figure 6:Results of few-shot teachers on 11 datasets across rounds on ImageNet(Left)and averaged across 10 datasets(Right).
Figure 7:Results on 10 datasets usingResNet-18under zero-shot distillation across 16 rounds.
Figure 8:Results on 10 datasets usingTinyViTunder zero-shot distillation across 16 rounds.
Figure 9:KNN loss (L2) and cluster purity of PCoreSet and other selection strategies across 10 datasets.

Figure 10:Comparison of four selection criteria: 1) Uncertainty, 2) Class balance, 3) Feature space diversity, and 4) Probability space diversity. The results are averaged over the 10 datasets excluding ImageNet.

Figure 11:The heatmap of output probability vectors from different selection strategies in the first active learning round using the DTD dataset.
SeeSec.E.1for results on other datasets.
